Legal_Issue: Extension of negative credibility finding to entire testimony
Application_Facts: Mr. Guney claimed refugee status based on persecution in Turkey and later added a fabricated conscientious objection claim
Court_Ruling: Allowed judicial review, invalidated RPD's decision due to unreasonable credibility assessment
Defendant_Behavior: Added a fabricated claim of conscientious objection
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness of extending negative credibility finding
Assessment_Factor: Plausibility of the remainder of the testimony despite one fabrication
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding unreasonably extended to entire testimony
Evidence_Used: Testimony of Mr. Guney, fabricated conscientious objection claim
Legal_Provision_Cited: Relevant provisions regarding credibility and refugee determination under IRPA
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution in country of origin
Evidence_Assessed: Credibility of testimony, consistency of claims
Governing_Rule: Tribunal may extend negative credibility finding only if it affects overall claim
Evidentiary_Deficiency: One fabricated element in otherwise plausible claim
Outcome: Decision remitted for redetermination before a different panel
Cause_Description: Fabricated conscientious objection claim undermined credibility, but not necessarily entire basis for refugee claim
Evidence_Handling: RPD discredited entire testimony based on single fabrication
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of procedural fairness and reasonable credibility assessment under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Overextension of credibility finding without sufficient justification
Residency_Compliance: Claimant was in Canada making a refugee claim
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA relating to refugee eligibility and credibility
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over judicial review of RPD decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient linkage between fabrication and implausibility of core claim
Decision_Rationale: Discrediting entire testimony due to one false claim was unreasonable
